column1: Along with lightheadedness and vertigo, you may also have: - Nausea, vomiting - Hearing loss - Ringing in your ears (tinnitus) - Vision problems, such as a feeling that things are jumping or moving - Loss of balance, difficulty standing up
Medicines may cause dizziness, or problems with your ear.
Vertigo can be a symptom of many disorders, as well.
Your health care provider may prescribe medicines for nausea and vomiting.

Commonly used medications include: - Dimenhydrinate - Meclizine - Sedatives such as diazepam (Valium) Too much water or fluid in your body may make the symptoms worse by increasing fluid pressure in your inner ear.
